qas.question: What part of a dog can be straight, curly or cork-screwed?
What does a dog communicate with its tail?
What part of a dog can be straight, curled, or cork-screwed?

context: There are many different shapes for dog <a0_0><a2_0>tails<a2_0/><a0_0/>: straight, straight up, sickle, curled, or cork-screw. As with many canids, one of the primary functions of a dog's tail is to communicate their <a1_0>emotional state<a1_0/>, which can be important in getting along with others. In some hunting dogs, however, the tail is traditionally docked to avoid injuries. In some breeds, such as the Braque du Bourbonnais, puppies can be born with a short tail or no tail at all.
